com.inamik.template
Class TemplateVariable

java.lang.Object
  com.inamik.template.TemplateVariable

public final class TemplateVariable
extends java.lang.Object

TemplateVariable - A container for variables within a template context.

At construction time, various attributes of the wrapped object are determined, via several instanceof checks, and the results stored and made available so as to help avoid further instanceof checks.

Created on Jul 12, 2006

Author:
Dave

Field Detail

NULL

public static final TemplateVariable NULL
A constant representing null. To facilitate easy comparisons, TemplateVariable.newInstnace() is guaranteed to return this constant if passed a null value.

TRUE

public static final TemplateVariable TRUE
A constant representing Boolean.TRUE. To facilitate easy comparisons, TemplateVariable.newInstnace() is guaranteed to return this constant if passed a Boolean of object where booleanValue() == true

FALSE

public static final TemplateVariable FALSE
A constant representing Boolean.FALSE. To facilitate easy comparisons, TemplateVariable.newInstnace() is guaranteed to return this constant if passed a Boolean of object where booleanValue() == false

ZERO

public static final TemplateVariable ZERO
A constant representing new Integer(0).

ONE

public static final TemplateVariable ONE
A constant representing new Integer(1).

Method Detail

newInstance

public static TemplateVariable newInstance(java.lang.Object object)
newInstance (Static) - Create a new TemplateVariable.

There can be only one instance of TemplateVariable that wraps a null value. That instance is defined as the constant TemplateVariable.NULL. Passing a null value into this method is guaranteed to return TemplateVariable.NULL

Passing a Boolean object into this method is guaranteed to return one of TemplateVariable.TRUE or TemplateVariable.FALSE. If you know that your source object is a Boolean, consider using the valueOf(boolean) method instead.

TemplateVariable cannot wrap another TemplateVariable instance. This method will simply return the passed-in object if it is a TemplateVariable.

Parameters:
object - The Object to be wrapped.
Returns:
A TemplateVariable, wrapping the passed in object.
See Also:
valueOf(boolean)

valueOf

public static TemplateVariable valueOf(boolean b)
valueOf (Static) w/boolean - Convenience method for wrapping a boolean in a TemplateVariable.

This method is equivelent to:

   b ? TemplateVariable.TRUE : TemplateVariable.FALSE

Parameters:
b - - The boolean to be wrapped
Returns:
One of TemplateVariable.TRUE or TemplateVariable.FALSE.

asObjectArray

public java.lang.Object[] asObjectArray()
asObjectArray - Retrieve the wrapped object as type java.lang.Object[].

If the wrapped object is not already of type java.lang.Object[] (i.e. isArray() == false), then this method will allocate a new Object array of size one (1) and store the wrapped value in the new array.

Returns:
The wrapped object as type java.lang.Object[]
See Also:
Object

asBoolean

public boolean asBoolean()
asBoolean - Retrieve the wrapped object as type boolean.

If the wrapped object is not already of type java.lang.Boolean, then this method will try to determine an appropriate value based on the object's type.

If the wrapped object is null, then the result is false.

If the wrapped object is of type java.lang.Number, then the result is true if number != 0, and false otherwise.

If the wrapped object is of type java.lang.String, then the result is true unless one of the following rules matches:

   false if string.length() == 0
   false if string.equalsIgnoreCase("false")
   false if string.equals("0")

If the wrapped object is a container who's size can be determined (i.e. this.isSizeable() == true, then the result is true if this.size() > 0 and false otherwise.

If the wrapped object is not of any of the above types, and is not null, then the result is true.

Returns:
The wrapped object as type boolean.

asDouble

public double asDouble()
asDouble - Retrieve the wrapped object as type double.

If the wrapped object is not already of type java.lang.Number, then this method will try to determine an appropriate value based on the object's type.

If the wrapped object is null, then the result is 0.0.

if the wrapped object is of type java.lang.String, then the result is Double.parseDouble(string).

If the wrapped object is of type java.lang.Boolean, then the result is boolean.booleanValue() ? 1.0 : 0.0.

If the wrapped object is a container who's size can be determined (i.e. this.isSizeable() == true), then the result is tihs.size().

If the wrapped object is not of any of the above types, and is not null, then the result is 1.0.

Returns:
The wrapped object as type double.
See Also:
Double.parseDouble(java.lang.String)

size

public int size()
size - For wrapped objects that are containers who's size can be determined (i.e. this.isSizeable() == true), get the size of the container.

Returns:
The size of the wrapped object, or 0 if it is not a container who's size can be determined.
See Also:
isSizeable()

getIndexProperty

public TemplateVariable getIndexProperty(int index)
getIndexedProperty - For wrapped objects that are containers that support numerical indexing (i.e. this.isIndesable() == true), get the object at the specified index within the container.

Returns:
A TemplateVariable containing the object at the specified index of the wrapped container, or TemplateVariable.NULL if the wrapped object is not a container that supports numerical indexing.
See Also:
isIndexable()

getMappedProperty

public TemplateVariable getMappedProperty(java.lang.Object key)
getMappedProperty - For wrapped objects that are containers that support key/value mapping (i.e. this.isMappable() == true), get the object with the specified key within the container.

Returns:
A TemplateVariable containing the object with the specified key within the wrapped container, or TemplateVariable.NULL if the wrapped object is not a container that key/value mapping.
See Also:
isMappable()

getNamedProperty

public TemplateVariable getNamedProperty(java.lang.String property)
                                  throws TemplateException
getNamedProperty - For wrapped objects that are Java Beans, get the named property of the bean.

This method uses the Apache Commons BeanUtils package.

Returns:
A TemplateVariable containing the named property of the wrapped bean, or TemplateVariable.NULL if the wrapped object is not a Java Bean.
Throws:
TemplateException - If the Apache BeanUtils package throws an exception, that exception is wrapped in a TemplateException and re-thrown.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
toString - Get the String representation of the wrapped object.

If the wrapped object is null, then the result is the empty String ("").

If the wrapped object is an array, the result is similar to how Lists perl toString (i.e. "[item0, item1, ...]").

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The String representation of the wrapped object.

public static java.lang.String asStringOrNull(TemplateVariable variable)
asStringOrNull - Get the String representation of the specified TemplateVariable, or null if the variable is null.

This is a convenience method and is equivelent to:

   TemplateVariable.asStringOrDefault(variable, null)

Returns:
The String representation of the specified TemplateVariable, or null if the variable is null.
See Also:
asStringOrDefault(TemplateVariable, String)

asStringOrDefault

public static java.lang.String asStringOrDefault(TemplateVariable variable,
                                                 java.lang.String defaultString)
asStringOrDefault - Getthe String representation of the specified TemplateVariable, or, if the variable is null, it returns the specified default.

The check for null is determined by variable == null and does not count the case where variable == TemplateVariable.NULL.

For non-null variables, the String representation is determined by a call to TemplateVariable.toString().

Returns:
The String representation of the specified TemplateVariable, or, if the variable is null, it returns the specified default.
See Also:
toString()
